meanings.definition: Remove (people or things) from a group until only the best ones are left.
meanings.sent1: The coach will winnow the team to select the top players.
meanings.sent2: Farmers winnowed the wheat to keep only the healthiest grains.
meanings.sent3: Trying to winnow the best jokes for the talent show was a tough task.
meanings.sent4: She had to winnow through the job applications to find the perfect candidate.
meanings.sent5: The competition will winnow out the weakest contenders.

meanings.definition: Blow air through (grain) in order to remove the chaff.
meanings.sent1: Using a fan, they winnowed the rice to get rid of the husks.
meanings.sent2: The traditional method to winnow rice involved tossing it in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully pretended to winnow the flour as if it were chaff.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to winnow away the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The breeze helped winnow the leaves off the tree branches.

meanings.definition: To separate or distinguish the good from the bad.
meanings.sent1: Her experience helped her winnow the genuine offers from the scams.
meanings.sent2: The detective had to winnow the truth from the suspect's lies.
meanings.sent3: It can be tricky to winnow the best deals from the overwhelming options.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's guidance helped winnow the correct answers from the mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The filter will winnow out impurities from the water.
